result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian Stuart Weston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE called to ask if his former Pymt Plan is separate from the Pymt Plan ordered on 19CM369. DE was advised that yes, his former PPA is now payable to Coll (SDC) & he was given their phone #. DE was also advised that the only case he will be making pymts to @ the COC is 19CM369. Includes 15CT56, 16CF33, 19CM265. jaf

DE appeared to add 19CM265 to current PPA. DE to continue paying $50/mo comm 8-01-19 (June & July pymts deferred, but DE must submit verification of Treatment Facility by 7-01-19). $10 PPF added. DE signed PPA. Includes 15CT56, 16CF33, 19CM265. jaf

DE called stating he submit a request but hasn't rec'd anything back yet.  DE was advised that I have his request & it will be processed this wk.  DE was advised that he didn't provide a mailing address to which the DE did state that his address has changed.  DE to submit a change of address via fax today, so that his updated Pymt Plan will be delivered.  DE was also advised that he may make a $50 pymt for his April 1st pymt.  DE inquired if the $50 monthly pymt would be permanent & was advised that at this time, yes it would be but that it could be subject to change upon review by the court & that he is encouraged to make larger pymts as he does have interest accruing on a monthly basis.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33.  jaf

From DE in writing.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 4-01-19 (pymt reduced from $75).  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt. jaf
**Court to review in 1 yr to increase pymt - DE to keep the court updated in writing of any address changes. jaf
to change payment plan to $50/month, filed by DE. jl   c: collections

Order for payment on November 7, 2018 at 08:45 am.

DE called to follow up on his v/m from yesterday.  DE was advised that I am going to defer his Oct pymt, but that going fwd, he cannot miss another pymt & any future requests will be sent to the Judge & may get denied again.  I recommended to the DE that he make his Nov pymt on 10-26-18 after he gets pd.  I did advise the DE that he may submit a request to reduce his pymt temporarily, but the DE stated he would like to keep it at $75.  DE was advised that he will be sent an amended Pymt Plan this wk & pymt is due 11-01-18.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33.  jaf
From DE stating he met w/his employer & will be getting pd on 10-26-18.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33.  jaf
From DE in writing.  DE to pay $75/mo comm 11-1-18 (Oct pymt deferred).  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33.  jaf

From DE inquiring about the status of his request.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him that the Judge denied his request.  DE was advised that if pymt is not made, he will be mailed out a 30 day notice on Fri & could potentially be sent to the Coll agency.  I advised the DE that if he were sent to Coll, he will be assessed a fee based on the amt that's being collected & that it may be in his best interest to follow his Pymt Plan.  DE stated he is meeting w/a new employer on Mon & was advised to call me after his meeting to let me know when his 1st paycheck is scheduled.  DE was also advised that the court may allow him to reduce his pymts temporarily, but pymts should not be skipped.  DE will call on 10-15-18.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33.  jaf

DE called to state that he is unable to make pymts because he is now in treatment as of 7-21-17.  DE was advised that the Judge noted in his last request for deferment that he would not be granted any add'l extensions, but that the DE may submit another request along with proof to the Judge for review.  It was noted to the DE that whatever he approves for the treatment ctr to submit to the court, will be scanned onto the court record & will be part of the public record - DE stated he did not mind.  DE was given all info required on his request, the fax #, & advised to submit his request by 8-01-17.  DE was also advised that whatever address he provides on his request, will be the address that his response for his deferment will be sent to.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33. jaf
17R 008401. Tax intercept of $85.00. RJG
rec'd $85.00 in tax intercept 17R 008401. eif

DE called to state that his taxes were intercepted & was inquiring if the Tax Intercept pymt was going to be applied to his monthly pymt.  DE was advised that once he has been warranted for non pymt, he is also sent through Tax Intercept until his bal is pd in full & that Tax Intercept pymts ARE NOT applied to his monthly pymt, but his total bal only.  DE inquired as to why it could not be applied & was advised that it is one of the repercussions of missing pymts - DE then disconnected the call immediately.  Includes 15CT56, 16CF33. jaf

DE left a message to give him a call but no other information about what he was calling about.  Returned call to DE and left a message that his payment is due 6-1-17 and no further extension will be granted. cah

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Ian Stuart Weston appeared from jail. Case called at 2:06. Includes 15CT56(PayH), 16CF33(PH).   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to the amended charge of  946.425(2) in 16CF33. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge 946.425(2). Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
10 days St. Croix County Jail consecutive to current sentence
6 days against the total sentence. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

Court postpones all payment for a period of 6 months. Court sets a payment plan of $75 a month beginning Jan. 1, 2017.
Atty Andrea. hml
Per SRN 6/20/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph Caton,  DF:  Ian Stuart Weston appeared from jail via video. Includes 15CT56 and 16CF33. Court questions Defendant. Court confirms address. QUASH WARRANT.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  ADA Hartung is requesting $1000.00 CB, Atty Caton argues.  Court suspends payments at this time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant in custody. eif
Surrounding States only             RMW signed 1/29/16 - c: DA & SCSO. eif
